{{Marvel Database:Organization Template | Image = Mutantes Sans Frontières (Earth-616) 0001.jpg | Name = Mutantes Sans Frontières | Aliases = [[MSF]], M.S.F., Mutants Without Borders{{r|X-Men Vol 2 #165}} | Leaders = [[Ororo Munroe (Earth-616)|Ororo Munroe]], formerly [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Warren Worthington III]]{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #1}} (founder){{r|Excalibur Vol 3 11}} | CurrentMembers = [[Ororo Munroe (Earth-616)|Ororo Munroe]], [[Paige Guthrie (Earth-616)|Paige Guthrie]],{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #1}} [[Jono Baraka (Earth-616)|Jono Baraka]],{{r|Excalibur Vol 3 11}} [[Helene St. Just (Earth-616)|Dr. Helene St. Just]],{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #2}} [[Doctor Hunter (Earth-616)|Dr. Hunter]] | FormerMembers = [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Warren Worthington III]] | Identity = Public | Affiliation = | Allies = [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]], [[T'Challa (Earth-616)|T'Challa]],{{r|Astonishing X-Men Vol 3 25}}{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #1}} [[Homo Superior|Mutants]], [[Warpies (Race)|Warpies]] | Enemies = | Origin = A non-governmental humanitarian organisation dedicated into the protection of [[Homo Superior|mutants]] rights | Reality = Earth-616 | Status = Active | BaseOfOperations = Mobile
Operating in: [[Karere]], [[Mbangawi]] | PlaceOfFormation = [[Zanzibar]] | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Chris Claremont; Aaron Lopresti | First = X-Men Vol 2 165 | History = ===Origin=== '''Mutantes Sans Frontières''' (or '''Mutants Without Borders''') was an idea of [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]].{{r|X-Men Vol 2 #165}} ===Actions=== One of their first actions was to bring members of the organization, along with [[Xavier Institute]] students and [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]], to serve soup at the [[Lambda Hospice]], a structure hosting human old and young people.{{r|X-Men Vol 2 #165}} ===[[Manifest Destiny]]=== After the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] [[Manifest Destiny|relocated]] in [[San Francisco]], [[Ororo Munroe (Earth-616)|Storm]] revealed that [[T'Challa (Earth-616)|T'Challa]] was financing M.S.F., who were in turn financing the X-Men's activities, including their new X-Jet.{{r|Astonishing X-Men Vol 3 25}} ====Exogenetic==== Later, during [[Kaga (Earth-616)|Kaga]]'s attack on the X-Men, [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]] asked for M.S.F. experts to come check the [[Sentinels|Bio-sentinel]], having much less work since the [[M-Day]]. {{r|Astonishing X-Men Vol 3 32}} ====Xenogenesis==== When [[Warpies (Race)|powered babies]] started to appear in the village of Karere, [[Mbangawi]], T'Challa sent M.S.F. doctors led by [[Helene St. Just (Earth-616)|Dr. Helene St. Just]] there, before calling the X-Men.{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #1}} The doctors were taken hostage by [[Joshua N'Dingi (Earth-616)|Joshua N'Dingi]], ruler of Mbangawi, and his men, who wanted to terminate the mutated children (not mutants but [[Warpies (Race)|Warpies]]) but were quickly freed by [[Emma Frost (Earth-616)|Emma Frost]]'s control on the soldiers.{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #2|3}} They later served as medics after the battle who opposed the X-Men and N'Dingi's soldiers to the [[Fury (Earth-10083)|Furies]].{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #5}} ===Proto-Mutant=== ... | Equipment = Medical equipment.{{r|Astonishing X-Men: Xenogenesis #2}} | Transportation = Several planes, helicopters and jets.{{r|Astonishing X-Men Vol 3 32}} Trucks.{{r|X-Men Vol 2 #165}} | Weapons = Protected by the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]]. | Notes = Mutantes Sans Frontières is seemingly inspired by [[Médecins Sans Frontières (Earth-616)|Médecins Sans Frontières]], which shares the acronym and part of the name; and also by the [[Red Cross (Earth-616)|Red Cross]], with a very similar symbol, a red X instead of a Red Cross. | Trivia = In French, the word "mutantes" would refer to an all-female group of mutants. The correct spelling for a group of mutants of both sexes would be the same as in English, "mutants". | Links = }} [[Category:Mutant Organizations]] [[Category:Medical Organizations]]
